  • Method Details

    • getUsername

      String getUsername(String jwtToken)
      Retrieves the username from the provided JWT token.
      example use:
           private final ClientServiceImpl PERSON_SERVICE
      
     String username = JWT_SERVICE.getUsername(JWT_TOKEN);
      Parameters:
      jwtToken - the JWT token from which to extract the username
      Returns:
      the username extracted from the JWT token

    • generateToken

      String generateToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Generates a JWT token for the provided UserDetails.

      The token is set to expire after one minute by default.

      Parameters:
      userDetails - the UserDetails object for which to generate the token
      Returns:
      the generated JWT token

    • generateToken

      String generateToken(Map<String,Object> extraClaims, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)

      This method generates a JWT token for the provided UserDetails object with additional custom claims specified in the extraClaims parameter.

      The token is set to expire after one minute by default.

      Parameters:
      extraClaims - additional custom claims to include in the JWT token
      userDetails - the UserDetails object for which to generate the token
      Returns:
      the generated JWT token with additional custom claims

    • generateRefreshToken

      String generateRefreshToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Generates a refresh token for the provided UserDetails with a default refresh time of one day.

      This method generates a refresh token for the provided UserDetails object, which can be used for refreshing access tokens after they expire.

      By default, the refresh token is set to expire after one day.

      Parameters:
      userDetails - the UserDetails object for which to generate the refresh token
      Returns:
      the generated refresh token

    • isTokenValid

      boolean isTokenValid(String jwtToken, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Validates whether the provided JWT token is valid for the given UserDetails.
      Parameters:
      jwtToken - the JWT token to validate
      userDetails - the UserDetails object against which to validate the token
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid for the UserDetails, otherwise false

    • getClaim

      <T> T getClaim(String jwtToken, Function<io.jsonwebtoken.Claims,T> claimsTFunction)
      Retrieves a specific claim from the provided JWT token.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the claim to retrieve
      Parameters:
      jwtToken - the JWT token from which to extract the claim
      claimsTFunction - a function to process and extract the desired claim from the token's payload
      Returns:
      the extracted claim from the JWT token
